input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Smoking has a direct effect on effort and freckles. Effort has a direct effect on freckles. The overall probability of smoking is 94%. The probability of nonsmoking and freckles is 5%. The probability of smoking and freckles is 54%. Is the chance of freckles smaller when observing smoking?
